vrt::Threadable

vrt::Threadable Class Reference

Utility class that handles common issues regarding threadable objects. More...

#include <Threadable.h>

Detailed Description

Utility class that handles common issues regarding threadable objects.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Basic no-argument constructor.

Basic copy constructor.

Basic copy constructor.

Member Function Documentation

void vrt::Threadable::close (  )  [inline]

Stops the object running.

This is identical to stop(true).

References stop().

VRTException* vrt::Threadable::getAbortError (  )  const

Get the error that caused the thread to abort.



The caller is responsible for deleting the returned object if not null.

Returns:
The error that caused run() to abort. This will return null if not done (see isDone()) and/or if it completed "normally".
Status vrt::Threadable::getStatus (  )  const

Gets the current status.

Note that during a restart the results of calling this function will be unpredictable.

bool vrt::Threadable::isDone (  )  const [inline]

Is this thread done?

bool vrt::Threadable::isStarted (  )  const [inline]

Is this thread started?

void vrt::Threadable::join (  ) 

Joins the object's thread.

void vrt::Threadable::run (  ) 

Runs the processing in the current thread.

In general, start should be used to start processing.

virtual void vrt::Threadable::runThread (  )  [protected, pure virtual]

Runs the thread.

Implemented in vrt::NetIO.

virtual void vrt::Threadable::shutdown (  )  [protected, virtual]

Closes any connections, This will always be called at the end of a call to run().

Reimplemented in vrt::NetIO.

void vrt::Threadable::sleep ( int64_t  millis  )  const [protected]

Sleeps for a given duration or until stopNow() is true.

Parameters:
millis The sleep duration in ms.
void vrt::Threadable::sleepUntil ( int64_t  sysTime  )  const [protected]

Sleeps until a given system time (see Utilities#currentTimeMillis()) or until stopNow() is true.

Parameters:
sysTime The system time to wait for (in ms).
virtual void vrt::Threadable::start (  )  [virtual]

Starts the object running in a new thread.

Exceptions:
VRTException If already running.

Reimplemented in vrt::NetIO.

Referenced by super_restart().

virtual void vrt::Threadable::stop ( bool  wait = true  )  [virtual]

Tells the object to stop running.

Parameters:
wait Wait for the thread to complete (true)?

Reimplemented in vrt::NetIO.

Referenced by close(), and super_restart().

bool vrt::Threadable::stopNow (  )  const [inline, protected]

Should this thread stop now?

void vrt::Threadable::super_restart (  )  [inline, protected]

Restarts the object in a new thread.

If an object supports restarts it should define the following: 

    public: void restart () { super_restart(); }

References start(), and stop().
